Job Description The Architectural Designer III performs their job functions under the supervision of a project’s Architect-of-Record, but have increasing areas of autonomy in their daily work. These include assisting 3D modeling and design, conducting field investigations, and producing discipline deliverables such as floor plans, reflected ceiling plans, finish plans, interior and exterior elevations and sections, schedules, and installation details in conformance with CRB’s VDC standards. Responsibilities Interface with client and external partners Plan work from an architectural design perspective Work on a variety of architectural assignments supporting all phases of design including initial programming, planning, feasibility, scope and concept development, detailed design, construction documentation, and construction administration Produce mostly complete deliverables (with oversight), and delegate work effectively to junior staff Qualifications Minimum Qualifications NAAB-accredited Professional Degree in Architecture (B.Arch., M. Arch, and/or D.
